sourcing.instructions: O: Purchase from a chemical supply company; Pr: Obtain from a specialty resin supplier; Sm: Source from a rare earth material distributor; Tc: Buy from a materials science supplier.
steps: O: Purchase from a chemical supply company; Pr: Obtain from a specialty resin supplier; Sm: Source from a rare earth material distributor; Tc: Buy from a materials science supplier.

1. Measure 600 g of O (e.g., oxide powder) and place it in a clean mixing container. 2. Add 40 g of Pr and mix thoroughly until homogeneous. 3. Gradually incorporate 40 g of Sm while continuously stirring. 4. Slowly add 240 g of Tc to the mixture while maintaining consistent agitation. 5. Ensure the mixture is uniform in consistency and color.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 600 g of O (e.g., oxide powder) and place it in a clean mixing container. 2. Add 40 g of Pr and mix thoroughly until homogeneous. 3. Gradually incorporate 40 g of Sm while continuously stirring. 4. Slowly add 240 g of Tc to the mixture while maintaining consistent agitation. 5. Ensure the mixture is uniform in consistency and color.

steps: Preheat an oven or furnace to 800°C (1472°F). Transfer the mixed material into a heat-resistant mold.  Heat for 2 hours to allow proper fusion of components.
heating.raw_text: Preheat an oven or furnace to 800°C (1472°F). Transfer the mixed material into a heat-resistant mold.  Heat for 2 hours to allow proper fusion of components.

steps: After heating, turn off the furnace and allow the sample to cool down gradually to room temperature (approximately 25°C) over a period of 6 hours to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: After heating, turn off the furnace and allow the sample to cool down gradually to room temperature (approximately 25°C) over a period of 6 hours to avoid thermal shock.

steps: Once cooled, remove the sample from the mold. Sand down any rough edges using 120-grit sandpaper, followed by 220-grit sandpaper for a smoother finish. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: Once cooled, remove the sample from the mold. Sand down any rough edges using 120-grit sandpaper, followed by 220-grit sandpaper for a smoother finish. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability.
